name: Sandman Inn Kamloops

reviews.title: Basic but OK for one night
reviews.text: Our family of 4 adults was travelling from Vancouver Island to Jasper in a hire car and needed somewhere to break the journey for one night and chose Kamloops. We picked the Sandman Inn through Expedia.
The Sandman Inn is easy to find and parking is on a forecourt outside reception. Space is fairly limited but we always found space.
reviews.title: Meets Basic Expectations
Terrible
reviews.text: The reception staff gave a poor initial impression; my wife commented that neither of the reception staff we met understood what customer care meant. We had to stand waiting for ages one time while the woman was on a long phone call.

The rooms were basic but OK. Our rooms were in a separate building over the way from reception in what looks like an apartment block, with external and internal access to the rooms. The rooms were hot (temperature outside was 32 degrees) but cooled down once the noisy window-mounted air conditioners were turned on. The rooms had reasonable facilities - the usual big TV, big comfy beds and a kitchenette area with fridge. For some reason only one of our rooms had a microwave and the cutlery/crockery in each room was limited and inconsistent; for example one room had a can opener but the other did not. No restaurant at the Inn; a diner adjoins the car park but we ate elsewhere.
reviews.title: Basic hotel
Noisy
reviews.text: OK if passing through but if doing the trip again would be tempted to look at some of the other travel inns nearby to see if value and customer service any better.

description: Motor Hotel located 4 blocks from downtown.
